@TheBiob also @this, it's like two separate converters, I might merge both of them in one but should fix up the code for that a bit first
what's new there
oh right
yeah
it's just the main level that's quick-loaded
that is indeed new
couple of things
1) the entire map16 buffers are stored uncompressed in rom
so they can just be DMA'd in there pretty quickly
2) everything not necessary for loading is skipped i.e. reloading gfx (which LM seems to always do), clearing the level, whatever else

3) while the fade-out is happening it already starts the tilemap building in ram and resetting ram, so by the time it fully faded out it just needs to DMA the tilemap it has and can immediately fade back in
â˜ï¸
funfact about that: the kldc version loaded in 5 frames, but did not do the fade out optimization
the smwc version *technically* loads slower, but you don't notice it because it happens during the 16-frame fadeout
yeah it's pretty neat
requires careful setup for the things the level needs though so unfortunately not quite a at a generic fast-load patch yet
yeah, though storing uncompressed isn't natively supported by LM and you lose objects running code on level load
the gfx thing is definitely an easy optimization
smw even has a system to keep track of which gfx files are loaded but LM just ... fails to? doesn't? take that into account
that i'm actually not sure about
i don't know what else that info would be stored for though
oh yeah the smwc version also fixes layer 3 resetting so dying during the goal walk animation doesn't force a full reload anymore
oh yeah, dunno if you saw but there's an option to keep animations playing while paused now
lui i think complained about not being able to tell if noteblocks bounce or not while paused
it's so clear though
the ? is also fixed :)
the kldc still had the black background around the ? because i forgot to remove it and didn't notice
